logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

def format_metrics_table(metrics_dict, title="Metrics", min_width=15):
    """
    Format metrics as a readable table with aligned columns.
    
    Args:
        metrics_dict: Dictionary of metrics to format
        title: Table title
        min_width: Minimum column width
        
    Returns:
        Formatted table as a string
    """
    # Calculate column widths
    key_width = max(len(str(k)) for k in metrics_dict.keys())
    val_width = max(len(f"{v:.4f}" if isinstance(v, float) else str(v)) for v in metrics_dict.values())
    
    # Ensure minimum width
    key_width = max(key_width, min_width)
    val_width = max(val_width, min_width)
    
    # Create header
    total_width = key_width + val_width + 3  # 3 for spacing and separator
    header = f"\n{title}\n" + "-" * total_width
    
    # Format each line
    lines = [header]
    for key, value in metrics_dict.items():
        if isinstance(value, float):
            val_str = f"{value:.4f}"
        else:
            val_str = str(value)
        lines.append(f"{str(key):<{key_width}} | {val_str:>{val_width}}")
    
    return "\n".join(lines)

def log_section(title, width=80):
    """
    Print a clearly defined section header in the log.
    
    Args:
        title: Section title
        width: Width of the section header
    """
    logger.info("\n" + "=" * width)
    logger.info(f"{title.center(width)}")
